message.content:
We only need to consider the “Initial” entries. In this problem the initial paid‐in capital is recorded in transactions with type “Cash deposit”, “Bank deposit” and “Fixed Assets” both dated on 2023‑12‑31. Their recorded amounts are:

• Cash deposit:  3,000,000.0  
• Bank deposit:  5,000,000.0  
• Fixed Assets:  8,000,000.0

Adding these together we get:

3,000,000.0 + 5,000,000.0 + 8,000,000.0 = 16,000,000.0

Since no later transactions affect the paid‑in capital (which represents the owners’ contributions), the paid‑in capital “end” value remains the same as the initial amount.

Thus, the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "16000000.00",
    "Paid-in Capital End Value": "16000000.00"
  }
}
